content.description:
“Children [born to] an Englishman [and] a Negro woman shall be bond or free according to the condition of the mother.”

Laws of Virginia, Act XII, adopted in 1662

“Negroes or Indians, though baptized and enjoying their own freedom, shall be incapable of purchasing Christians, yet they are not debarred from buying any of their own color.”                                     

Laws of Virginia, Act V, adopted in 1670
content.question: The excerpts best reflect which of the following historical developments in English colonies during the 1600s?

choices.label: The growing employment of American Indian workers
An increasing preference for enslaved labor
Decreasing efforts to spread Christianity to Africans
A declining demand for enslaved workers due to shortages of arable land

content.answer: An increasing preference for enslaved labor

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify and describe a historical context for a specific historical development or process.
